description:
Who We're Looking For Toyota Motors North America's (TMNA) Information Technology Department is looking for a Sr. Director of Data Science & Machine Learning Practice within the CTO organization to productize machine learning applications and systems at scale. You'll participate in the detailed technical design, development, and implementation of machine learning applications using existing and emerging technology platforms. This role will be a remote position with the expectation to travel to HQ on an as-needed basis. Reporting to the Enterprise Deputy Chief Technology Officer, you'll serve as a technical domain expert in machine learning, guiding machine learning architectural design decisions, developing and reviewing model and application code, and ensuring high availability and performance of our machine learning applications. You'll have the opportunity to continuously learn and apply the latest innovations and best practices in machine learning engineering. You'll also mentor other ML engineers and Data Scientists and further develop your technical knowledge and skills to keep TMNA at the cutting edge of technology. This role will be critical to the department's efforts to recast its relationship with business functions from a provider of technology to a business partner capable of innovating business practices through the delivery of technology services. Candidates for this position must be highly motivated, able to make data-driven decisions and have strong management and interpersonal skills. This person will interact with a wide variety of diverse individuals, including business stakeholders, IT leadership teams across the global Toyota ecosystem. The ideal candidate is someone who understands both Agile-based Software Development, and Machine Learning pipelines ideally has overseen production deployment of ML models, and has managed global teams with a total team size of 100
employees (plus additional support from vendors in various locations). What You'll Be Doing o Deliver ML models and software components that solve challenging business problems preferably in the automotive industry, working in collaboration with the Business, Product, Architecture, Engineering, and Cloud teams. o Drive the creation and evolution of ML models and software that enable state-of-the-art intelligent systems. o Lead large-scale ML initiatives with the customer in mind. o Leverage cloud-based architectures and technologies to deliver optimized ML models at scale. o Optimize data pipelines to feed ML models. o Use programming languages like Python, Scala, or Java. o Promote best practices in all aspects of the engineering and modeling lifecycles. o Hires, trains, and develops talent for growth opportunities; monitors team/individual's morale and engagement to maintain highly effective and collaborative environments; drives the talent strategy and best practices across the team Qualifications What You Bring o Ph.D. in Statistics o Strong understanding of state-of-the-art data science techniques including deep learning architectures, reinforcement learning, generative adversarial networks, and convolutional neural networks. o Extensive experience in designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing. o Experience delivering Advanced Analytics solutions in large enterprises. o Experience programming with Python, Scala, or Java. o People management experience. o Experience in leading software engineering teams. o Experience with the full ML development lifecycle using modern technology in a business-critical setting. o Experience delivering ML solutions using structured, time series, text, images, video, and audio.
Salary Range:
$80K -- $100K
Minimum Qualification
Data Science & Machine Learning, Technology ManagementEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
